title: My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5%
dot:
digraph G{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];edge[fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10];Start[label="Start: Idea to reduce npm package size by 5% using Zopfli", shape=ellipse];TechnicalBackground[label="Technical Background:
1. npm packages are gzipped tarballs
2. Zopfli compresses better than gzip"];ProofOfConcept[label="Proof of Concept:
Tested on personal npm packages, achieved ~5% size reduction"];Feedback[label="Feedback:
1. Decompression time negligible
2. Only applicable to new packages"];RFC[label="RFC: Submitted proposal to npm CLI team"];Discussion[label="Discussion:
Concerns about benefits, performance, and integration"];Investigation[label="Investigation:
Explored pros and cons, performance implications"];Rejection[label="Rejection:
RFC closed after weighing pros and cons"];LessonsLearned[label="Lessons Learned:
1. Improved proposal skills
2. Better communication needed
3. Not all obvious wins are wins"];Start->TechnicalBackground;TechnicalBackground->ProofOfConcept;ProofOfConcept->Feedback;Feedback->RFC;RFC->Discussion;Discussion->Investigation;Investigation->Rejection;Rejection->LessonsLearned;{rank=same;TechnicalBackground->ProofOfConcept[style=invis]};{rank=same;Feedback->RFC[style=invis]};{rank=same;Discussion->Investigation[style=invis]};{rank=same;Investigation->Rejection[style=invis]};{rank=same;Rejection->LessonsLearned[style=invis]};}
